result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

To: Branch 2 re: victim statement -N.B.

NOT ON RECORD - JA TOOK UP. Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa appeared by video means for Defendant Jordan David Bloy. Prosecuting Atty Isaac R. Lent appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jordan David Bloy appeared by video means. Offer just received. Requesting additional time to consider. PTC date set.
Pre-trial conference on November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant appears via telephone.  Court denies Defense's motion to modify bond. Same bond continues.
The Court heard the Motion to Modify Bond at a hearing and denied the motion.
Motion hearing on July 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
